data.benefits:
1. Fair Taxation
2. Uniform Tax Base
3. Set-off Provision
4. Exemptions for Special Categories
data.eligibility:
1. MAT is applicable to all companies, whether domestic or foreign, that have income under the Income-tax Act and prepare profit and loss accounts under the Companies Act, 2013. 
  2. There are certain exceptions of these where MAT is not applicable
data.conditions:
1. Book Profits Basis 

2. Adjustments to Book Profits 

3. Carry Forward of MAT Credit
data.beneficiaries:
1. Applicability:  MAT is applicable to all companies, whether domestic or foreign, that have income under the Income-tax Act and prepare profit and loss accounts under the Companies Act, 2013. 

2. Exceptions: 

a) Companies covered under Section 115BAA and 115BAB (opt for reduced corporate tax rates). 

b) A foreign company if: - Its income arises solely from businesses such as shipping, aircraft operations, or oil exploration activities, and it enjoys specific treaty benefits. - It does not have a Permanent Establishment (PE) in India.
data.prerequisites:
1. Book Profits Basis: MAT is calculated at 15% of book profits (plus surcharge and cess), as reflected in the company's profit and loss account, subject to adjustments specified in the Act. 

2. Adjustments to Book Profits: Certain incomes and expenses are added back or deducted to/from book profits for MAT computation (e.g., depreciation adjustments, revaluation of assets, or expenses disallowed under the normal provisions). 

3. Carry Forward of MAT Credit: MAT paid in excess of normal tax liability can be carried forward for up to 15 assessment years.
data.description:
1. Fair Taxation: MAT ensures that companies reporting substantial book profits but paying negligible or no income tax under normal provisions contribute a minimum tax. 

2. Uniform Tax Base: Brings parity by applying a uniform tax base on book profits. 

3. Set-off Provision: MAT credit can be carried forward for 15 assessment years and utilized against regular tax liability in subsequent years, subject to conditions. 

4. Exemptions for Special Categories: 

a) Companies in International Financial Services Centres (IFSCs) are taxed at a lower rate of 9% on book profits. 

b) Certain deductions/exemptions are preserved for companies under specific circumstances (e.g., income from life insurance business).
data.how_to_apply: Claim by filing Income Tax Return
data.funding_mechanism: Claim by filing Income Tax Return .Opt in required by assessee- No
